New Records: Babar and Rizwan became the first pair to register three century stands in T20 World Cup history.
Key Match Events: Rizwan was named Player of the Match for his top-scoring effort of 57.
A disciplined bowling show at the start limited New Zealand to 152 despite the Mitchell-Williamson partnership.
Babar and Rizwan eased Pakistan's opening worries with a brilliant century stand.
Boult broke the century opening stand with the wicket of Babar.
Rizwan fell on 43-ball 57, caught by Phillips off Boult.
Mitchell's unbeaten 53 and Williamson's 46 off 42 led New Zealand to 152/4.
Afridi broke the stand with Williamson's wicket.
Nawaz struck with the wicket of Glenn Phillips.
Shadab's direct hit run out dismissed Conway.
Afridi dismissed Allen in the opening over.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams were unchanged for the key clash.
New Zealand opted to bat first after winning the toss.
Six out of seven games had been won by teams batting first at the SCG.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan are the first finalists of T20 World Cup 2022.
Pakistan's journey included losing their opener to India on the final ball and a second successive game to Zimbabwe, but they made a remarkable turnaround to reach the finals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch seemed to have eased out a bit during Pakistan's chase.
New Zealand's top-order struggles had them worried initially, but Williamson and Mitchell's partnership led the recovery.
Pakistan's ground fielding was excellent throughout the match.
